541.06
 
 
903.01  SAFETY REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   All trees and shrubbery along streets, sidewalks and alleys shall be
kept trimmed so as to permit safe passage by vehicles and pedestrians, and a
clear and unobstructed view of traffic and traffic control devices, including
public lights or lamps.
   (b)   There shall be a clearance of fourteen feet between streets and the
lowest branches of trees and shrubbery.
   (c)   There shall be a clearance of nine feet between sidewalks and alleys
and the lowest branches of trees and shrubbery.
   (d)   Any trees or shrubbery along any street, alley or sidewalk that
creates a safety hazard or does not comply with this chapter shall be removed
by the property owner.
(Ord. 99-27.  Passed 5-17-99.)
903.02  NOTICE TO TRIM.
   (a)   Upon obtaining information that trees or shrubbery on applicable lots
or lands is in violation of the requirements set forth in Section
903.01 hereof, the Manager or designee shall cause written notice to be served
on the owner or person having charge of such lots or lands that such trees or
shrubbery shall be trimmed or removed within ten days after service of such
notice.  Notice shall be sent by certified mail.  If the address is not known
or certified  mail is not accepted or received, it shall be sufficient to
publish such notice one time in a newspaper of general circulation in the
Municipality.
   (b)   If the owner or person having charge of lots or lands in violation of
this section fails to comply with the notice within the time period stipulated,
the Manager or designee is authorized to enter upon such lots or lands and
shall cause such trees or shrubbery to be trimmed or removed by the direct
employment of Municipal laborers or shall authorize a person to trim or remove
such trees or shrubbery on behalf of the Municipality.  All expenses and costs
incurred shall be paid out of municipal funds appropriated by Council for this
purpose.
   (c)   When the Manager or designee causes trees or shrubbery to be trimmed
or removed, a statement of cost thereof shall be mailed to the owner of such
lots or lands by certified mail, return receipt requested.  Such statement of
cost shall include the following:
      (1)   Administration and supervision;
      (2)   Transportation of personnel and equipment;
      (3)   Equipment rental;
      (4)   Equipment operator;
      (5)   Incidental labor; and
      (6)   Cost of equipment damages or repairs directly related to the work
performed on the owner’s property.
   (d)   When a person not directly employed by the Municipality is authorized
to perform such work, a statement shall be for one hundred twenty-five percent
(125%) of the contractual cost.  If payment is not forthcoming within thirty
days of receipt of the statement, Council shall cause all costs incurred by the
Municipality in trimming or removing such trees to be entered upon the tax
duplicate and shall be a lien upon such lots or lands.
   (e)   Each notice to trim or remove trees or shrubbery shall state that if
the notice is not complied with within the time limit provided therein, in
addition to the penalty provided in Section
903.99, costs incurred by the Municipality in trimming and removing trees or
shrubbery shall be entered upon the tax duplicate and shall be a lien upon such
lots or lands.
(Ord. 99-27.  Passed 5-17-99.)
903.99  PENALTY.
   Any owner or person having charge of or responsibility for maintenance of
the lots or lands within the Municipality who fails to comply with any of the
provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor.  Each day’s
violation shall constitute a separate offense.  (Ord. 99-27.  Passed 5-17-99.)
CHAPTER 905
Numbering of Buildings
905.01   Authority to assign numbers.
905.02   Assignment specifications.
905.03   Compliance required; display of numbers.
905.04   Reassignment.
905.05   Responsibility to number building.
905.06   Damaging; wrong numbers.
905.07   Marking numbers on sidewalks, streets and curbs.
905.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate building numbering - see Ohio R.C. 715.26
 
 
905.01  AUTHORITY TO ASSIGN NUMBERS.
   To provide for a systematic numbering of buildings in the Municipality, the
Manager or the Manager's designee shall assign such numbers to all buildings
fronting streets, alleys, avenues or any public thoroughfare.
(Ord. 93-40.  Passed 7-19-93.)
905.02  ASSIGNMENT SPECIFICATIONS.
   The Manager shall create and maintain specifications for assigning numbers.
(Ord. 93-40.  Passed 7-19-93.)
905.03  COMPLIANCE REQUIRED; DISPLAY OF NUMBERS.
   Every house or building in the Municipality shall have posted in a
conspicuous manner the identifying house or building number thereof which has
been assigned to such house or building at the nearest practical point to the
entrance of such building, or upon the mailbox in the event roadside rural
mailboxes are in use, in such a manner that the street number may at all times
be plainly legible from the street or sidewalk in front of the building.  For
the purpose or intent of this chapter, the front shall be construed as that
side of the house or building which faces the street on which such building is
situated, and that the number shall be displayed on such side of such building
or premises.  All house or building numbers shall be of contrasting color with
the surface upon which they are posted and shall be at least three inches in
height.
(Ord. 93-40.  Passed 7-19-93.)
905.04  REASSIGNMENT.
   Where necessary or feasible, any building numbers existing at the present
time or in the future may be reassigned in accordance with the provisions of
this chapter.
(Ord. 93-40.  Passed 7-19-93.)
905.05  RESPONSIBILITY TO NUMBER BUILDING.
   It shall be the duty of the owner, occupant, lessee or agent of any owner of
a building to cause such building to be numbered as herein provided for within
thirty days after receiving notice from the Municipality to do so.
(Ord. 93-40.  Passed 7-19-93.)
905.06  DAMAGING; WRONG NUMBERS.
   No person in any manner shall interfere with the affixing of any number to
any building or remove, destroy or deface any number of any building assigned
and affixed thereon.  No person, after having received the notice provided for
in Section
905.05, shall retain an improper number, substitute any other number on a
building other than the numbers assigned in the manner provided for in this
chapter.
(Ord. 93-40.  Passed 7-19-93.)
905.07  MARKING NUMBERS ON SIDEWALKS, STREETS AND CURBS.
   No person shall paint, print, stencil or otherwise mark an address or
building identification number upon a sidewalk, street or curb of the
Municipality without first obtaining permission therefor from the Manager. 
Such marking shall be done in accordance with the specifications supplied by
the Manager.
(Ord. 93-40.  Passed 7-19-93.)
905.99  PENALTY.
   Any owner, agent, occupant, lessee or tenant of any building in the
Municipality who, after written notification by the Manager or the Manager's
designee of maintaining an illegible, unreadable building number or any other
violation of this chapter, fails to correct the condition in accordance with
the requirements of this chapter is guilty of a minor misdemeanor and shall be
fined not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00) for each offense.
(Ord. 93-40.  Passed 7-19-93.)

919.005 WATER SERVICE DEFINED.
   For purposes of interpretation and enforcement of any and all laws of the
Municipality and of the State and Federal government, the “municipal water
system” means the pipe supplying water to a consumer from the water main to the
main stop within a building or structure.  The water meter within a building
shall be installed at the outlet side of this main stop.  If the meter is
outside of the building, it shall be installed in a meter pit between the curb
and sidewalk.  No water meter shall be removed other than by an employee of the
Municipality.
   The part of the water service extending from the curb box or meter to the
main stop within the building or structure shall be installed and maintained at
the expense of the consumer and shall be installed to meet the requirements of
these regulations.
(Ord. 92-41.  Passed 7-20-92.)
919.01  PERMIT FOR CONSTRUCTION WATER; FEE.
   All persons, firms or corporations constructing any homes or buildings of
any nature whatsoever shall obtain from the Finance Department a permit for
construction water, the fee for which shall be ten dollars ($10.00) per month
from the time tap is made and water is available on site until the permit water
meter is installed.  Such permit shall be obtained and paid for at the time the
building permit is obtained.  This provision shall not apply to the
construction of garages or additions to existing buildings, where the water tap
has already been made to the Municipally owned system and the lot upon which
the improvement being built is occupied.  (Ord. 95-59.  Passed 10-2-95.)
919.02  WATER TAP PERMIT REQUIRED.
   Tapping into the public water system is required for all new construction
within the incorporated area of the municipality.  No person shall tap into any
City water line without first obtaining a permit from the Zoning Department and
paying the required tap-in fee.
(Ord. 05-21.  Passed 4-18-05.)
919.03  TAP-IN FEE; ASSESSMENT.
   (a)   The following tap-in charges shall be applicable per unit depending
upon the size of the service line:

(in inches)

(Ord.  03-09.  Passed 2-18-03.)
   (b)   When water taps are made exclusively for fire sprinkler purposes, tap-
in fees shall be waived.  The Manager may require a meter to measure the water
used.
   (c)   Units shall be described as follows:
      (1)   Single-family residences shall be one unit;
      (2)   Every two apartments, townhouses and multiple-dwellings, or
fraction thereof, in one building, will be designated as one unit;
      (3)   Every four rooms or fraction thereof in a hotel, motel or office
building will be designated as one unit; and
      (4)   Every commercial unit in a commercial building will be designated
as one unit.
   (d)   An additional minimum assessment of four dollars and fifty cents
($4.50) per front foot shall be charged for any installation tapped in part of
the system installed by the City, the cost of which has not been and will not
be assessed against the abutting property.
(Ord. 981.  Passed 6-17-68.)
   (e)    All water tap-in fees shall be paid prior to the issuance of a
building permit on new structures.  Tap-in fees must be paid within thirty days
following receipt of an invoice on tap-in fees made in conjunction with special
assessment projects.  Installation services shall be paid in advance.  No
permit shall be issued until such time as the tap-in fee has been paid, in
full.  In the event that the tap-in is not made within six months subsequent to
the date of the issuance of the permit, said permit shall expire and shall be
considered void.
(Ord. 14-48.  Passed 6-16-14.)
919.04  PERMITTEE TO PAY INSTALLATION EXPENSE.
   In addition to the fees set forth in Sections
919.01 and
919.03, the permittee shall pay the following charges and be responsible for
the installation of service:
 
(a)    For installation of a water pit Cost plus 25%
A water pit shall be required for any structure that is located seventy-five
feet or more from the water main.
(b)    For installation of a remote metCost plus 25%
A remote meter shall be required for all new construction and the installation
fee shall be paid when the tap permit is obtained.
      (Ord. 95-59.  Passed 10-2-95.)
919.05  CITY TO MAKE TAP; INSPECTION.
   The Superintendent of the Water and Sewer Department or his agent shall make
the actual tap into the water line. He shall inspect the construction of the
line and connection thereto, which must be approved prior to being covered up
by the permittee.
(Ord. 981. Passed 6-17-68.)
919.06  TAMPERING WITH WATER SYSTEM.
   No person shall place or deposit any dirt or material in any fire hydrant or
in any valve box or stopcock box, or commit any act tending to obstruct the use
thereof or injure in any manner any fixture connected with the City water
system. No person shall commit any act tending to deface, damage or obstruct in
any manner any building, machinery, pipes, apparatus or other fixtures of the
City water system.  (Ord. 981.  Passed 6-17-68.)
919.07  INTERFERENCE WITH WATER FLOW; UNAUTHORIZED CONNECTIONS.
   No person shall open, close, adjust or interfere with a fire hydrant, valve,
regulator, gauge, gate, disc, curbcock, stopcock, meter or other regulator,
operating or measuring device or appliance in or attached to the wells, tanks,
reservoirs, conduits, pipes, mains, service pipes, house pipes or other pipes
or apparatus of the City water system so as to cause the escape of water or to
injure or destroy such property. No person shall tap, sever, open or make
unauthorized connections with a main or pipe used or intended for the
transmission of water. This section does not apply to any City agent or
employee for that purpose or to anything done by or under authority of the Fire
Department. (Ord. 981.  Passed 6-17-68.)

   (b)    Any residence, whether a single-family residence or apartment,
containing more than one family, shall pay the minimum monthly charge for each
and every family residing therein. Every commercial unit in a commercial

one-half times higher than the rates prevailing within the corporate limits.
(Ord. 80-41.  Passed 9-2-80.)
   (d)    Should the water bill rendered for any property or user served by the
water system remain unpaid by the thirtieth of the billing month, a ten percent

   (e)    Should the water bill rendered for any property or user served by the
water system remain unpaid by the thirtieth of the billing month, the water

the water supply during regular working hours and a one hundred  dollar

(Ord. 17-14.  Passed 4-17-17.)

water bills rendered to any property or user served by the water system and to

   (h)    A fee of fifty-five dollars ($55.00) shall be charged for the
installation of a remote meter unless such installation is for the purpose of
replacing a defective meter.
(Ord. 88-49.  Passed 9-6-88.)
   (i)    Any account that is established with the City for water services
shall be in the name of the property owner who shall be responsible for the
payment of any water charges, provided, however, that any account in the name
of a tenant may continue until the tenancy terminates and the tenant shall be
responsible for the payment of any water charges.
(Ord. 89-1.  Passed 1-17-89.)
RULES REGARDING UTILITY BILL ADJUSTMENTS
      (1)   Purpose.  It is the intent of the City to accurately bill consumers
for services rendered and to attempt to ensure the financial integrity of the
utilities of the City. These regulations are established pursuant to Codified
Ordinances Section
919.08(g), in order to establish a procedure whereby a consumer may question
his utility bill.
      (2)    Consumer may request reread.  The initial procedure for a consumer
to question his utility bill shall constitute a request that the meter reading
be verified. The consumer may make such a request verbally or in writing at the
Municipal Building during normal business hours. A City employee shall then be
scheduled to verify the reading as soon as possible after receipt of the
request. The consumer should then contact the Municipal Building for
verification of the accuracy of the bill. In the event that the meter reading
is judged to be in error by the designated collection agent of the City, an
adjustment shall be made to the water and sewer charges to correct the error.
In the event that the meter reading is judged to be accurate, the utility bill
shall remain due and payable in full.  (Ord.  1031.  Passed 3-16- 70.)
      (3)    Meter tests.  A consumer may request the accuracy of the water
meter be verified. In the event that the meter is three-fourths of an inch (3/
4") or smaller, the City shall test the meter against a factory calibrated and
certified meter. Larger meters shall be tested at a competent testing facility.
The meter shall be tested at both a slow flow and fast flow rate and shall be
judged to be accurate if it is within one and one-half percent (1-1/2%) of one
hundred percent (100%). This standard has been established by the American
Water Works Association which is a professional society of water utility
managers and operators. In addition to the meter tests, an air test shall be
applied to the occupant's plumbing to ensure that a higher reading has not been
obtained due to faulty plumbing. If the meter is reading accurately or less
than ninety-eight and one-half percent (98-1/2%) of actual consumption,
regardless of the results of the air test, the consumer shall be liable for a
twenty-five dollar ($25.00) service charge. If the test should prove that the
meter is registering more than one hundred one and one-half percent (101-1/2%)
of actual consumption, the bill for the current quarter shall be adjusted by
the collection agent and there shall be no service charge for the meter test or
the air test. In the event that a consumer has a leak in the service line
between a meter pit and their structure or where it can be otherwise verified
that the water does not enter the sanitary sewer, the sewer charge shall be
adjusted upon request by the customer based upon the average of the previous
four quarters of consumption.
         (Ord.  02-53.  Passed 11-4-02.)
      (4)    Appeal to Manager.  In the event that the facts surrounding the
reread, meter test or air test are in dispute, a consumer may request a meeting
with the Manager to attempt to establish the facts of the situation. In the
event that a factual error has been made, the Manager shall order the tests to
be repeated. Upon establishment of the facts, the Manager may adjust the
utility bill as he deems appropriate. However, in no event shall the Manager
adjust a utility bill without some factual evidence that would establish that
the consumer has not received the service for which he has been billed. If the
consumer is not satisfied with the results of the meeting with the Manager, he
may make an appeal to Council.
      (5)    Appeal to Council.  Utility customers may make a final appeal to
Council for adjustment of their utility bill. The appeal shall be submitted in
writing and shall include a statement regarding appellant's belief regarding
the nature of the alleged inaccurate billing and shall request a specific
amount to be adjusted. The appeal shall be submitted at least three full
working days prior to the next regular or special meeting of Council. Appellant
may then appear before Council or a committee of Council and shall be permitted
to make a statement which would further substantiate his claim. Council may
then consider the appeal and shall render a decision at that meeting or at the
next meeting of Council. The decision of Council shall be final and shall be
entered into the minutes of the regular or special meeting of Council. (Ord.
1031.  Passed 3-16-70.)
   (j)   Overpayment of a final utility bill resulting in a balance of less
than one dollar ($1.00) shall not be refunded and the utility account will be
adjusted accordingly.
(Ord. 11-38.  Passed 9-19-11.)
   (k)    The Manager is authorized to direct the shut off of water to any
premise being serviced by water if the owner/agent who is responsible for the
payment of any water charges refuses to allow admittance of a duly authorized
employee of the Municipality to the premise being served with water for the
purpose of reading water meters, checking for cross-connections, maintenance or
other activity necessary for the proper operation of the municipal water
system.
(Ord. 93-81.  Passed 12-6-93.)
   (l)   Each charge levied pursuant to this chapter is made a lien upon the
corresponding lot, land or premises served by a connection to the water system
of the Municipality, and upon becoming delinquent the water service may be shut
off and the charges shall be certified to the County Auditor, who shall place
such charges on the tax duplicate of the County, along with interest and
penalties allowed by law.  This charge, including interest and penalties, shall
be collected as other taxes are collected. 
(Ord. 14-31.  Passed 4-21-14.)
919.09  TEMPORARY BAN OF WATER USAGE,
   (a)    The Manager subject to Council approval is hereby authorized to ban
on a temporary basis any unnecessary or nonemergency use of water within the
Municipality, including watering of lawns, washing cars and nonemergency
household use.
   (b)    Such temporary bans shall be declared in writing and notice thereof
shall be posted at the Municipal Building and given to the local media.
   (c)    Such temporary ban shall expire at the end of one week unless renewed
by the Manager or his designee and can be terminated by the Manager or his
designee at any time.
   (d)    Anyone who violates such temporary ban shall first be given a
warning, then in the event of a second violation shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor and subject to a possible fine of up to one hundred dollars
($100.00) for the second and each subsequent violation.
(Ord. 79-52.  Passed 11-5-79.)
919.10  PERMANENT SPRINKLING METERS.
   A permanent meter for sprinkling will be provided by the City upon written
application from the property owner requesting such, a meter under the
following terms:
   (a)    The property owner shall be responsible for the cost of the meter,
which shall include an approved backflow prevention device.
   (b)   The meter shall be installed and inspected by an employee of the
City's Department of Public Service and the property owner shall be responsible
for the parts necessary to make the installation as well as the labor for
installation and inspection. Any auxiliary plumbing required and conducted by
or contracted by the property owner shall be at the owner's expense and shall
be subject to an inspection by an employee of the Department of Public Service.
   (c)    The meter shall be set in line after the primary meter and shall be
inspected on a periodic basis to determine that no cross connections have been
made to the domestic water line.
   (d)    The meter shall be read in the manner in which the primary meter is
read. The useage for the sprinkling meter shall be deducted from the primary
meter and charged a water rate only.
   (e)    The meter shall be maintained in accordance with existing meter
installations. (Ord. 88-33.  Passed 7-5-88.)
919.11  OUTDOOR PORTABLE RESIDENTIAL METERS.
   An outdoor portable residential meter will be provided by the Municipality
pursuant to the following terms:
   (a)    Meters shall be available for residential use from May 15 through
October 15 and may be used at any time during this five-month period. The
meters must be returned by October 20.
   (b)    Application must be made to the Billing Clerk on the forms provided
and shall be subject to the availability of a meter. Meters shall be ordered
from and returned to the Billing Clerk's Office at the Municipal Building.
Instructions for installation will be provided by the Municipality.
   (c)   A one hundred dollar ($100.00) per meter deposit shall be paid prior
to receiving each meter.  An administrative user fee of twenty-two dollars
($22.00), an installation fee of fifteen dollars ($15.00) and a retrieval fee
of fifteen dollars ($15.00) per meter shall be deducted from the deposit upon
return of the meter.  Such fees shall be credited to the water fund.  In
addition, any damage to the meter will be deducted from the deposit.
   (d)    Sewer charges shall be waived on the amount of water used through the
meter.
   (e)    Customer billing accounts shall be adjusted during the next regular
billing following return of the meter.
   (f)    The Municipality of Germantown reserves the right to discontinue to
provide such meters and recall outstanding meters at any time if it interferes
with the normal operation and supply of water service to the citizens of
Germantown.
      (Ord. 95-07.  Passed 3-6-95.)
919.12  APPLICATION FOR WATER EXTENSION.
   (a)    When any property owner desires an extension of the Municipal water
system to serve their property, they shall make a written application to the
Manager requesting such extension. Each such application shall be evaluated by
the Manager in accordance with Section
919.21(a) and (b).
 
   (b)    Council, upon the recommendation of the Manager, shall determine the
method of construction and financing to be utilized in accordance with Section
919.22(c).
(Ord. 92-65.  Passed 11-2-92.)
919.13  REVIEW BY COUNCIL; PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING.
   For projects determined by Council to be constructed and financed in
accordance with Sections
919.13 through
919.20, the preparation of preliminary plans and cost estimates may be
required. The cost of any preliminary engineering shall be borne by the
applicant.
(Ord. 92-65.  Passed 11-2-92.)
919.14  SIZE OF EXTENSIONS, LOCATION; SYSTEM CAPACITY.
   Council, upon the recommendation of the Manager, shall determine the size of
any water extension and shall specify its location. Due consideration shall be
given to the requirements of the applicant, the effect on adjacent properties,
and future development in the area. Council shall also decide and be the sole
judge of the location of the water system where sufficient capacity exists for
any extension. That location shall then become the beginning point for the
extension which was applied for.  (Ord. 91-72.  Passed 11-18-91.)
919.15  DISTRIBUTION OF COSTS; OVERSIZING.
   (a)    Each extension shall be constructed with sufficient capacity to serve
the complete development of the applicant's property, and the applicant shall
bear the entire cost thereof. Council shall make the final determination of all
line sizes based on the recommendation of the Manager.
   (b)    If Council requests that the extension be constructed with capacity
greater than that required to serve the applicant, the Municipality shall pay
the difference between the line which is authorized and the line which the
applicant requires.
   (c)    Council and the applicant shall agree in writing, prior to
construction, on the portion of the costs to be paid by each party. This
agreement shall be based on records, prices, estimates, bids and other
information available at the time prior to construction.
   (d)    The costs for any extension shall include, but not be limited to, the
costs for labor, material, engineering, inspection and financing.  (Ord. 91-
72.  Passed 11-18-91.)
919.16  INSTALLATION AND PAYMENT.
   (a)    Any water line constructed under this section, as directed by Council
in Section
919.22(c) shall be installed and financed by the Municipality.
   (b)    The Manager shall prepare a Plan of Financing for projects
constructed under subsection (a) hereof to include:
      (1)    Tap-in fees or assessments to be levied on users of the project
(if any);
      (2)    Portions of annual user charge revenues to be ear-marked for debt
retirement of this project (if any);
      (3)    Water Capital Improvement Funds to be ear-marked for debt
retirement of this project (if any).
   (c)    Funds identified in subsections (b)(2) and (3) hereof shall be an
encumbrance on the Water Fund for the term of the financing of the project and
shall be so certified by the Chief Financial Officer of the Municipality.
   (d)    Contributions by intervening users as defined in Section
919.18 shall remain entirely with the Municipality for any water line
constructed and financed under this section.
(Ord. 92-65.  Passed 11-2-92.)
919.17  RECORDS OF WATER LINE EXTENSION.
   Upon the completion and acceptance of a water line extension, the
Municipality shall make appropriate records of the nature, extent, location and
cost of such extension.
(Ord. 91-72. Passed 11-18-91.)
919.18  CONTRIBUTION BY INTERVENING OWNERS.
   (a)    Whenever the owner or owners of any intervening property or
properties shall thereafter apply to the Municipality for right to tap into or
make connection with a water line extension, the Manager shall compute and
certify to such person the pro-rata cost of construction of that section of
line abutting the person's property and shall, before issuing permit to tap
into or connect therewith, receive such pro-rata contribution or reimbursement
and upon receipt remit a pro-rata share to the applicant. The determination of
the Manager as to the amount of such contribution shall, in the absence of
willful fraud or misconduct, be conclusive as between the Municipality and the
applicant.
   (b)    The sums in subsection (a) hereof which are to be contributed by
intervening owners shall be in addition to and exclusive of fees required and
fixed by ordinance as inspection or permit fees for connection with or tap into
water lines. 
(Ord. 91-72.  Passed 11-18-91.)
919.19  APPLICANTS' LIABILITY.
   When an applicant is authorized to construct an extension, the applicant
shall deposit with the Manager a waiver of liability which shall save the
Municipality and its employees free and harmless from any and all damages or
claims for damages which may arise or grow out of the extension and shall
defend at the applicant's own expense any and all suits for the recovery of
damages arising or growing out of the construction of such extension which may
be brought or prosecuted against the Municipality or its employees.
(Ord. 91-72.  Passed 11-18-91.)
919.20  TERM OF AGREEMENT.
   Upon completion of all possible connections to the extension, but in any
event at the end of a ten year period from the date of acceptance, all claims
of the applicant for a reimbursement under Section
919.18, shall cease. If at any time during the ten year period the original
applicant or their successors cannot be located for purposes of a reimbursement
under Section
919.18 herein, the applicant shall be deemed to have forfeited his claims to
any further reimbursements. In such cases, the contribution of the intervening
owner shall be placed in the Water Extension Fund for use as Council may
designate. Upon the written request of the applicant, Council may extend the
term of the agreement if it determines that the circumstances at the end of the
original period warrant the extension.  (Ord. 91-72.  Passed 11-18-91.)
919.21  ESTABLISHMENT OF EVALUATION SYSTEM FOR UTILITY EXTENSIONS AND CHARGES.
   Council herein establishes the "Evaluation System for Utility Extensions and
Charges" dated June, 1992. This evaluation system shall be maintained by the
Manager and utilized to objectively evaluate the benefit of a proposed utility
extension to the Municipality.
(Ord. 92-65.  Passed 11-2-92.)
919.22  EVALUATION OF WATER EXTENSION BENEFIT.
   (a)    Upon receipt of an application for water extension as required by
Section
919.12, or for a water line extension proposed by the Manager, the Manager
shall prepare an evaluation of the water extension's benefit to the
Municipality, utilizing the Evaluation System established in Section
919.21.
   (b)    The Manager shall forward to Council a summary of the evaluation
containing the following information:
      (1)    Project cost;
      (2)    Anticipated revenue generated;
      (3)    Portion of revenue available for debt retirement;
      (4)    Consistency with Municipality Annexation/General Development
Plans;
      (5)    Environmental impact;
      (6)    Additional water system funds required for project implementation.
   (c)    Council, upon the recommendation of the Manager, shall determine
whether the proposed water extension will be constructed and financed as
described in Section
919.13 through Section
919.20; or alternatively as described in Section
919.16, where such project is evaluated as being in the long term best interest
of the community due to the enhancement of community growth, economic
development and environmental protection.
(Ord. 92-65.  Passed 11-2-92.)
919.23  WEAVER ROAD WATER TAP WAIVER.
   (a)    The Manager is hereby authorized to waive the payment of water tap-in
fees set forth in Sections
919.02 and
919.03 in connection with the Weaver Road waterline extension for the following
described property located on Weaver Road:
      (1)    Property presently connected to the Municipality's water system
through a less than twelve inch waterline;
      (2)    Property with existing houses not presently connected to the
Municipality's water system. Waiver of such tap is contingent upon the
following:
         A.    Tap shall be made within six months from the date of completion
and activation of such waterline extension;
         B.    Service shall continue uninterrupted for a period of two years
from the date such tap is made, except interrupted service which is deemed
necessary by the Manager for repairs and/or maintenance on such waterline; and
         C.    The monthly minimum charge shall be paid on time for a period of
two years from the date such tap is made.
      (3)    Presently vacant property shall receive one free tap for each
benefit assessed to such vacant property, provided, however, that any such tap
shall be made prior to any structure being completed and/or occupied.
   (b)    Such waivers shall only apply to three-fourths inch taps.
(Ord. 93-44.  Passed 8-2-93.)
919.24  WATER EXPANSION CHARGE.
   (a)   There is hereby established a charge for public water service to all
water system customers who connect to the water system after the effective date
of this section.  This charge shall be known as a water expansion charge.
   (b)   Water expansion charges shall be levied in accordance with the size of
the water line serving the facility:
 
Service Line Size (in inches) Charge
Three-fourths                 $1,500
One                           1,800
One and one-half              2,200
Two                           3,400
Three                         13,200
Four                          16,200
Six                           24,200
 
(Ord.  06-65.  Passed 10-2-06.)
   (c)   All water expansion charges shall be paid prior to the issuance of a
building permit, or in the case of an existing facility, prior to the tapping
of the water main.
   (d)   Upon payment of the water expansion charge, a permit shall be issued. 
If the water main has not been tapped within six months after the date of
issuance of the permit, the permit shall expire and be considered void and any
reissuance shall be subject to current rates.
   (e)   Water expansion charges shall be deposited to the credit of the Water
Capital Improvement Fund and shall be used for capital improvements to the
water system.
(Ord. 98-21.  Passed 4-6-98.)
919.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisoned not more than six
months, or both
(Ord. 981.  Passed 6-17-68.)
CHAPTER 920
Water System Control of Backflow Contaminants
920.01   Backflow prevention device required; installation.
920.02   Water supply and connection approval.
920.03   Surveys and investigations.
920.04   Right of entry.
920.05   Service discontinued.
920.06   Regulations adopted.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to provide and regulate system - see Ohio R.C. 715.08, 717.01, 743.01
Water regulations - see S. & P.S. Ch.
919
 
 
920.01  BACKFLOW PREVENTION DEVICE REQUIRED; INSTALLATION.
   If, in the judgment of the Supervisor of Water and Sanitary Sewers,
hereafter "Supervisor", an approved backflow prevention device is necessary for
the safety of the public water systems, the Supervisor shall give notice to the
water consumer to install such an approved device immediately.  The water
consumer shall, at his own expense, install such an approved device at a
location and in a manner approved by the Supervisor and shall have inspections
and tests made of such approved devices as required by the Supervisor.
(Ord. 92-39.  Passed 7-6-92.)
920.02  WATER SUPPLY AND CONNECTION APPROVAL.
   No person, firm or corporation shall establish or permit to be established
or maintain or permit to be maintained any connection whereby a private,
auxiliary or emergency water supply other than the regular public water supply
of the Municipality may enter the supply or distributing system of such
Municipality, unless such private, auxiliary or emergency water supply and the
method of connection and use of such supply shall have been approved by the
Supervisor and by the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency.
(Ord. 92-39.  Passed 7-6-92.)
920.03  SURVEYS AND INVESTIGATIONS.
   The Supervisor shall cause surveys and investigations to be made of
industrial and other properties served by the public water supply where actual
or potential hazards to the public water supply may exist.  Such surveys and
investigations shall be made a matter of public record and shall be repeated as
often as the Supervisor shall deem necessary.
(Ord. 92-39.  Passed 7-6-92.)
920.04  RIGHT OF ENTRY.
   The Supervisor or his or her duly authorized representative shall have the
right to enter at any reasonable time any property served by a connection to
the public water supply or distributing system of the Municipality for the
purpose of inspecting the piping system or systems thereof.  On demand the
owner, lessees or occupants of any property so served shall furnish to the
Supervisor any information which he may request regarding the piping system or
systems or water use on such property.  The refusal of such information, when
demanded, shall, within the discretion of the Supervisor, be deemed evidence of
the presence of improper connection as provided in this chapter.
(Ord. 92-39.  Passed 7-6-92.)
920.05  SERVICE DISCONTINUED.
   The Supervisor is hereby authorized and directed to discontinue, after
reasonable notice to the occupant thereof, the water service to any property
wherein any connection in violation of the provision of this chapter is known
to exist, and to take such other precautionary measures as he may deem
necessary to eliminate any danger of contamination of the public water supply
distribution mains.  Water service to such property shall not be restored until
such conditions shall have been eliminated or corrected in compliance with the
provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 92-39.  Passed 7-6-92.)
920.06  REGULATIONS ADOPTED.
   The Supervisor, with the approval of the Municipal Manager, shall adopt such
regulations in accordance with law to facilitate the operation of this chapter.
(Ord. 92-39.  Passed 7-6-92.)
